Package datastructure

Class VariantContent

java.lang.Object
datastructure.VariantContent
public final class VariantContent
extends java.lang.Object
Stores information about the content of a single genomic position of one sample relative to a reference (genetic sequence).
Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static char ALT_A
    Character to indicate an alternative A nucleotide.
    static char ALT_C
    Character to indicate an alternative C nucleotide.
    static char ALT_G
    Character to indicate an alternative G nucleotide.
    static char ALT_T
    Character to indicate an alternative T nucleotide.
    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> annotations
    Additional annotation key, value pairs associated with the position.
    char content
    The alternate content (base symbol) of the variant position.
    double coverage
    The depth of coverage of the position
    static char DELETION
    Character to indicate a deletion relative to the reference.
    double frequency
    The frequency of the alternate content of the variant position.
    static char INSERTION_DUMMY
    ...
    boolean MFA
    Indicates if the content is of the most frequent allele.
    static char NO_CALL
    Character to indicate a no call position.
    double quality
    The Phred-scaled quality score of the position.
    static char REFERENCE
    Character to indicate a reference call, i.e. no variant at the position.
    static char SEPARATOR
    Separator character used for generating annotation strings.

  • Constructor Details

    • VariantContent

      public VariantContent​(char content, double quality, double coverage, double frequency, boolean isMFA)
      Constructor of VariantContent.
      Parameters:
      content - Character representation of the variants content.
      quality - Double representing the quality (phred scaled likelihood of call being wrong) of the variant.
      coverage - Double representing the depth of coverage of the variants position.
      frequency - Double representing the frequency of the variant wrt. other variants on the same position and the number of supporting reads.
      isMFA - Boolean indicating if this variant is the most frequent variant.

  • Method Details

    • addAnnotation

      public void addAnnotation​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Adds a new annotation value accessible via the specified key to the annotations map of this object.
      Parameters:
      key - String representing the key of the annotation.
      value - String representing the value of the annotation.
